solution_line_template: On Monday Kendra saw {monday_sites} sites x {monday_avg_birds} birds/site = <<{monday_sites}*{monday_avg_birds}={monday_total_birds}>>{monday_total_birds} different birds
On Tuesday Kendra saw {tuesday_sites} sites x {tuesday_avg_birds} birds/site = <<{tuesday_sites}*{tuesday_avg_birds}={tuesday_total_birds}>>{tuesday_total_birds} different birds
On Wednesday Kendra saw {wednesday_sites} sites x {wednesday_avg_birds} birds/site = <<{wednesday_sites}*{wednesday_avg_birds}={wednesday_total_birds}>>{wednesday_total_birds} different birds

In total Kendra saw {monday_total_birds} birds + {tuesday_total_birds} birds + {wednesday_total_birds} birds = <<{monday_total_birds}+{tuesday_total_birds}+{wednesday_total_birds}={total_birds_seen}>>{total_birds_seen} different birds
In total Kendra visited {monday_sites} sites + {tuesday_sites} sites + {wednesday_sites} sites = <<{monday_sites}+{tuesday_sites}+{wednesday_sites}={total_sites_visited}>>{total_sites_visited} sites.

On average Kendra saw {total_birds_seen} birds / {total_sites_visited} sites = <<{total_birds_seen}/{total_sites_visited}={average_birds_per_site}>>{average_birds_per_site} different birds at each site
